lexUnit.name: storm.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move angrily or forcefully in a specified direction.

sentence.text: He would tear up the lead card , and would storm back to his desk .
Finally , Mrs Popple decided to throw a dinner-plate -- they had just finished eating -- and Albert Popple stormed out of the house .
` She had a blazing row with Eddie and stormed out of the house , " Rachel replied .
Then Dad stormed right into the house and up the stairs to see me .
Jenna snapped , spinning away and storming off towards the house .
When Gilroy explained the commercial necessities of having to recast , and offered him the job of understudy and assistant stage manager , he stormed out of the theatre in a rage .
Several French bankers stormed out of one meeting , grumbling that Britain 's legal standards had sunk to the level of Venezuela 's .
Earlier , in Soweto township , south-west of Johannesburg , four people were killed when gunmen stormed into a taxi-association meeting .
On this particular occasion , one of their dinner-time meetings , she simply burst into tears and stormed off .
He would storm off upstairs , banging his feet on the steps as he went , groaning ` For cripes ' sakes " .
He hurled a chair across the set , smashing lamps and vases , then stormed off to his dressing room .
I 'm not playing any more , " and she stormed off the court , convinced that everyone at the club house was laughing at her .
I was in such a state that I stupidly paid the 40 bill and stormed out .
Will got up and , as fast as his old body would allow , stormed out into the garden , leaving his children , mouths agape , behind him .
He plunged towards the door , and before Cassie could stop him , had wrenched it open and stormed out into the hall , crashing the door shut behind him .
Well , one year , I must admit , somebody in the class stormed out .
I storm across the board and topple his bishop or something , then turn round and find he 's closed the back door .
Withel stormed across the floor , his face a mask of rage .
I stormed across the wet barren sands towards the thin line of sea on the distant horizon .
He turned and stormed from the room , slamming the door behind him as he went , his departing footsteps echoing , unrelenting , on the marble tiles .
Her diatribe was cut off by Michael who stormed into the kitchen .
This week an irate mother reportedly stormed into a London school and hauled her 15-year-old daughter out of a class in elementary sapphism .
He laughed softly as he moved away again , and Fran stormed into the room and slammed the door , but it was n't that easy to close the door on what he 'd said .
Colour flared into her face when Fred and the rest of the team stormed into the room , but when she tried to pull away from him Luke drew her back .
He stormed into the square , sending another red-coated soldier sprawling , backhanding him into the mud , and tossing his sword after him .
She slid out of her bunk , grabbed her robe and stormed through the galley into his cabin .
Then , almost alone , he awaited his fate , and as the British troops stormed through the gateway of his stronghold he shot himself with a pistol sent to him in happier days by Queen Victoria .
Mansell , who had rushed away to the Williams garage where the doors were immediately closed behind him , later emerged red-faced with anger to storm to the stewards ' tower .
I heard no more of the debate and to the astonishment of my fellow delegates I stormed out of the auditorium and locked myself away in the Ladies to howl out my rage , alone .
After he finished he stormed out of the building and I have n't seen him since . "
He told them both never to leave the house again , and stormed out of the room , slamming the door hard enough to break a chunk of plaster out of the wall .
He jerked his head up , astonished , but before he could utter a word in his defence , Fei Yen had whirled about and stormed across to where the two girls stood .
The traffic was too heavy for her to go to the driver 's side and she stormed along the pavement to the offending car and opened the passenger door .
